thread.title: House GOP challenges Obama in court
thread.title_full: House GOP challenges Obama in court

author: Peter Sullivan
title: House GOP challenges Obama in court
text:
House GOP challenges Obama in court By Peter Sullivan - 05/28/15 11:33 AM EDT 
A federal judge on Thursday volleyed tough questions at the Obama administration during oral arguments in the House Republican lawsuit against President Obama’s use of executive power.The Obama administration argues that the House lacks legal standing and asked the court to dismiss the lawsuit. ADVERTISEMENT Administration lawyer Joel McElvain said the issue is a "generalized" dispute and there is no particular harm to House, meaning lawmakers have no standing.Federal District Judge Rosemary Collyer, an appointee of President George W. Bush, pressed McElvain on "why you think this just an abstract issue of law.""I want to know where you find the appropriation," she said. The lawsuit focuses on two issues related to ObamaCare.
House Republicans argue the administration is unconstitutionally making payments to insurers to help cover low-income household’s expenses under a section of ObamaCare. The House argues the administration is paying out the money despite Congress never appropriating it. 
Second, the House is challenging administration’s delay of the mandate for employers to provide insurance. While the Affordable Care Act set the mandate to begin in 2014, the administration first delayed it until 2015 and then delayed it again for medium-sized employers until 2016.
